result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dillon M Heiller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more other charges, Dillon M Heiller was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dillon M Heiller is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

State by Vasupuram / Def in custody w/ Atty Joe Randtke
Vasupuram:  In preparing for trial, State has come across a number of jail calls where def is talking to victim - he's on cash bond - there is a no contact condition on the bond - asks CRT to revoke def's telephone & visitation privileges - State will be charging him w/ Intimidation of a Victim...
Randtke:  are we addressing telephone privileges today?
CRT:  yes - w/ regard to forfeiture by wrongdoing I'm going to hear that this afternoon
Randtke:  I'll be in Pepin Co this afternoon...
CRT:  you can have the morning to review & CRT will hear this @ 11am
Randtke:  will be in Buffalo Co @ 11am - my calendar is packed
CRT:  go in back & talk about Motion now - maybe we'll do it now
BACK IN SESSION - Same Appearances
Randtke:  we can proceed right now & maybe resolve both issues - my client doesn't object to rescinding telephone & mail privilege but would like to be able to contact his family
CRT:  UNTIL CONCLUSION OF TRIAL, THERE WOULD BE NO CONTACT W/ ANYONE - THE ANSWER TO THAT QUESTION IS NO - BASED ON AFFIDAVIT OF STATE & CALLS FROM THE DEF, THE STATE HAS MET ITS BURDEN - STATES MOTION IS GRANTED 
AS TO FORFEITURE OF WRONGDOING - WE WILL PROCEED...
Inv. Robert Muth Sworn/Testified
CRT is reviewing transcript of Prelim Hrg in this matter...CRT is satisfied based upon testimony of Inv. Muth & recorded calls made that def cont'd to use vic's fear to intimidate her from being available for testimony...CRT is satisfied that def has in fact forfeited his right to confrontation w/ victim in this case & the case will proceed w/o her having to appear.  The State has asked for an opportunity to amend the charges w/ regard to def for purposes of trial on Mon. - I don't beleive that is sufficient time for them to prepare a defense - State can file your charges but they won't be heard at the time as trial next week - Case will proceed to trial
CRT:  Other issue to put on table - I assume w/ counsel leaving CRTRM there was further discussions for Plea?  I want to remind counsel that itme for plea is past - any new offer would have to be approved by the CRT
State's Motion to Admit Victim's Testimonial Stmts under Forfeiture by Wrongdoing

Motion to Impeach
State asked for 12 convictions
Randtke objects - prejudicial
Court: If the Def testifies, the answer is "Yes" and "7" times.
Daubert Motion
State wish this to be held the morning of trial, don't think it will 
take more than an hour to resolve.
Court: Will hold Daubert Motion until morning of Trial
State no objection to Defense Motion in Limine.
Court: Victim has a right to be present at Trial.
As to Speedy Trial...
Randtke - He is held over time limits - request Sig Bond effective 08-18-15.
Court makes comments - request for release is Denied
Defendant rejects offer.
Court: State to withdraw that offer at this time and the matter will proceed to trial.
